intro: Oenothera pseudoelongata, commonly known as the narrowleaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has slender, upright stems and linear, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers produce a large amount of nectar, attracting various pollinators such as moths and beetles. Oenothera pseudoelongata is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
